SENT.plain: Thrombolysis may achieve recanalization in cases of occlusion of the cerebral vessels
If therapy is initiated in good time, development of cerebral infarction may be at least partially prevented
Thrombolytic treatment was performed in 14 patients at the Wagner-Jauregg Hospital within a period of one year
Urokinase was given locally, while rtPA was applied locally and/or systemically
4 patients had an occlusion of the internal carotid artery, 6 an occlusion of the middle cerebral artery, and 4 an occlusion of the basilar artery
Complete recanalization was achieved in 6 patients, partial recanalization in 4, and no recanalization in 4
The neurological outcome of the cases with complete recanalization was good with the exception of one patients who died
Partial recanalization resulted in a fair outcome in 2 patients, while the other 2 died
3 out of the 4 patients in whom no recanalization was achieved died
Our findings show that this form of therapy may considerably improve the natural history of the disease, provided recanalization is achieved in good time
They encourage us to continue this form of therapy and to work at improving the therapeutic criteria
